intro: Hedythyrsus spermacocinus, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are arranged in clusters and resemble small stars. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Hedythyrsus spermacocinus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
